sources.title: Porky's Bear Facts (1941)
sources.description: Porky’s Bear Facts is a 1941 Warner Bros. Looney Tunes cartoon animated short directed by Friz Freleng. The short was released on March 29, 1941, and stars Porky Pig. The voices were performed by Mel Blanc. Watch on RetroFlix.org:  https://retroflix.org/porkys-bear-facts-1941/

sources.title: Porky's Bear Facts (1941)
sources.description: Farmer Porky prepares for winter by sowing plenty of seeds during the summer. When winter arrives, his lazy neighbors are without food and must rely on him.

metadata.Plot: A variant on the fable of the grasshopper and the ants: Porky is a hardworking farmer, while his neighbor, a bear, sings "working can wait" (as do all his animals). Winter comes, and the only scrap of food in his drafty cabin is a single bean, which a mouse steals. As he stalks his dog past Porky's cabin, he sees the feast on Porky's table and begs to join him.
